CatDescriptText: Mrs. Julia Arvin, 1118 Pennsylvania Avenue and Mr. Roger Jones, 2433 Waring Court, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "In your opinion, what constitutes the 'Leadership' in Negro community in Pittsburgh? What do you think of that which exists?" answer reads: "What I've seen, I would say that the North Side does not have any.  I can't speak for Pittsburgh as a whole, but I might say that in some cases the reason we don't have good leadership is because of the opposition among ourselves."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Julia Arvin and Roger Jones, standing in front of Roosevelt Hotel, Penn Avenue, Downtown
